Comments_List: As someone with no prior experience in art or painting, I emerged from the class with skills and knowledge in painting far beyond what I had expected. I learned a number of skills related to painting still lives, how to properly prepare and use oil paints, and how to create my own canvasses. I now feel comfortable purchasing painting materials and starting my own projects, and I hope to retain painting as a hobby in the future.
How to use oil paints, mixing medium, stretching and gessoing canvases
I learned about basic painting skills and developed my artistic style. I also became more skilled in painting techniques, such as which mediums to use.
Learned how to paint with oil paints for the first time. Learned how to paint with a different perspective through still life subjects.
Although I've enjoyed every assignment and there was more flexibility towards the end, I wished we didn't confine ourselves to painting still life all semester.

I wish we had had more time for the final, seeing as it required twice the work of our normal assignments. Otherwise, I felt the course was well structured, and the instruction was informative and helpful. I especially loved our visits to the YUAG, as they helped me learn to interpret and better appreciate painting as an art form.

Its a very fun and relaxed class. We spent most of the time in class painting still-lifes and sometimes we would critique our projects or go to the YUAG to talk about paintings. I like how color was introduced gradually; we started off with black and white and we did many two-tone paintings before using a full palette. The only weakness Id say is that there isnt much opportunity to paint things that arent still-lifes.
The strengths of the course was the high level of teaching. I enjoyed the opportunity evaluate paintings alongside my class.
I wish we were able to do a little more creative assignments than just still life studies.

I would absolutely recommend taking this course with Troy Michie. He was a great instructor, always keeping class fun and engaging. His instruction helped me go from someone with no art or painting experience to being comfortable with a paintbrush and proud of the work I produced.

I would recommend this class if you want a relaxing, fun class. Its definitely better for beginners who might not have oil painted before. If youre not a beginner, if might feel slow and boring at some points.
Yes, absolutely. I think it is a great fundamental course for anyone interested in painting.
Yes! It was a very relaxing and fun class to take. I've learned a lot that I can apply to my painting outside of class.
